title: Chinese Government Sponsors 69 Scholarships for Zambian Students
description: In 2018, the Chinese Government awarded 69 Zambian students various scholarships at Chinese universities. This donation includes 33 students under the Chinese Government Scholarship program, 9 under the Youth of Excellence Scheme of China (YES CHINA) Master Program, and 27 under the Economic, Military, and Confucius Institute Scholarship Programs. At the time of the send-off ceremony for Chinese Government Scholarship recipients on 22 August 2018, nearly 4,000 Zambian students were studying in China, and the Chinese government had provided over 900 scholarships to Zambian students over the years.

title: ICBC provides $210 million buyer’s credit for Zambia National Service (ZNS) 2000 Affordable Housing Project
description: In 2018, the Industrial and Commercial Bank of China (ICBC) provided a $210 million buyer’s credit (loan) to the Development Bank of Zambia (DBZ) for the Zambia National Service (ZNS) 2000 Affordable Housing Project. The terms of this loan are unknown. However, it is known that the proceeds from the loan were used to be used by the borrower to finance 85% of the cost of a $247 million commercial contract between Shandong Dejian Group Co., Ltd. and Zambia National Service (ZNS). The purpose of the project is to construct 2000 housing units for the Zambia National Service (ZNS) in all service cantonments across the country over a period of three years.  According to the Dezhou Municipal People's Government (SourceID#151086), this project adopted an on-lending commercial loan model ("该项目采用转贷的商业贷款模式"). DBZ on-lent the funds to the developer, Zambia Cooperative Federation (ZCF), for hiring a project contractor. The borrowing terms are unknown.  Project implementation commenced on March 30, 2017. The construction cycle for the project is three years, with the expected completion date to be in 2020. According a report published by SAIS-CARI in 2021, the ICBC loan had disbursed $84 million.
staff_comments: 1. This project is also known as the 2,000 Housing Units for Zambia National Service Project. The Chinese project title is 赞比亚国民卫队2000套经济适用房项目 or 国民卫队2000套经济适用房项目.2. This may be the second phase of the Ministry of Defense Housing Project captured in Project ID#57377. The issue warrants further investigation.3. The Zambia National Service abbreviated as ZNS is part of the Zambian Defence Force whose primary objective is to train Zambian citizens in agriculture and craft skills. it was formed in 1963 as a Land Army before it was renamed to Zambia National Service.4. Due to the fact that the ICBC loan was used to finance 85% of the total cost of a commercial contract with Shandong Dejian Group Co., Ltd., AidData assumes that it was provided in the form of an export buyer’s credit. It is unclear if the export buyer’s credit is of a preferential nature or non-preferential nature. This issue warrants further investigation.5. At the project commencement ceremony, the President of Zambia refereed to the Zambia National Service (ZNS) 2000 Affordable Housing Project as a joint venture between Zambia’s Ministry of Defence, Shandong Dejian Group Co., Ltd., and Zambia Cooperative Federation (ZCF). This issue warrants further investigation.

title: PowerChina donates materials to Zambia to fight cholera
description: On January 15, 2018, China Power Construction Group Co. Ltd. (PowerChina) donated a batch of supplies to the Zambian government to fight the cholera epidemic. The donated materials included bleaching powder, hand sanitizer, buckets, disinfectant, sterilizing hand sanitizer, hand-washing bucket holders, goggles, masks, and rubber shoes, etc. The total value of the donation is 100,000 Kwacha or about 70,000 CNY. The company also provided 3 dump trucks to the Zambian Ministry of Health to clean up garbage and prevent and control the epidemic. Zambia officials said the outbreak was almost under control. title: CBMI provides $408 million supplier credit for Ndola Cement Plant Project
description: On December 4, 2018, CBMI Construction Co., Ltd. (Sinoma) reportedly provided a $408 million supplier credit to Central African Cement Limited (CAC) for the Ndola Cement Plant Project. The terms of this supplier credit (loan) are unknown.  Central African Cement Limited (CAC) is a special purpose vehicle (SPV) and joint venture of Zambia Consolidated Copper Mines Investment Holdings (ZCCM-IH) and China Machinery Construction Group Limited (SinoConst) that was created in July 2018 to design, finance, and implemented the Ndola Cement Plant Project. ZCCM-IH holds a 35% equity stake and Sinoconst holds a 65% equity stake in CAC. CBMI Construction Co., Limited (Sinoma) signed a $480 million EPC contract with CAC on July 30, 2018 to implement the project.  The Ndola Cement Plant Project is located in Ndola within Masaiti District and Copperbelt Province. It involves the construction of a plant with a daily output of 5,000 tonnes of cement and two coal-fired power plants (2X25MW) to provide electricity to the cement plant.  According to ZCCM-IH's Chief Executive Officer, Pias Kasolo, the construction of the cement plant was originally scheduled to commence in April 2019. However, as of February 2022, AidData had not yet identified any evidence of project implementation.

title: CJIC provides $16.94 million bridge loan for 330kV Kabwe-Pensulo Second Transmission Line Project (Linked to Project ID#72967)
description: On August 20 2018, China Jiangxi Corporation for International Economic and Technical Cooperation (CJIC) provided a $16.94 million bridge loan (supplier’s credit) to ZESCO — a state-owned power company in Zambia — for the 330kV Kabwe-Pensulo Second Transmission Line Project. The loan carried the following borrowing terms: a 1.33 year maturity (16 months), no grace period, and a 10% interest rate. The balance of the loan, as of December 31, 2019, was $10.6 million. This project involved the construction of a 300 km, 330 kV second transmission line to improve the security and reliability of the supply of electricity between the Pensulo substation and the town of Kabwe.  CJIC is the contractor responsible for implementation. Construction began on November 21, 2019. The project had reportedly achieved a 70% completion rate as of October 8, 2020. The originally expected project implementation commencement and conclusion dates were March 15, 2019 and December 30, 2020, respectively.

title: China Eximbank provides funding for the design review and construction supervision for Zambian Road Development Agency Headquarters Construction Project (Linked to Project ID #57287, 89293)
